subject: Gardening
title: Korean Natural Farming
description: A 60-second lesson on Korean Natural Farming.

hook.text: Korean Natural Farming uses no purchased inputs. Everythingâ€”fertilizer, pest control, seed treatment.

buildup.text: Developed by Cho Han-kyu, the system uses indigenous microorganisms (IMO) collected from local forest floors.

discovery.text: Forest floor microbes are cultured on rice, then spread on fields. They suppress pathogens and speed decay.

twist.text: KNF is now practiced in 30+ countries. Hawaii's farms adopted it to reduce costly imported fertilizers by up to 90%.

climax.text: Korean Natural Farming proves that local ecosystems contain everything needed for productive agriculture.

punchline.text: The best farm inputs are freeâ€”already in your local forest.

quiz.question: What are indigenous microorganisms (IMO) in Korean Natural Farming?
options: Genetically modified bacteria developed in Korean laboratories
Microbes collected from local forest floors and cultured for agricultural use
Imported soil bacteria from Korea's volcanic Jeju Island
